comment.author: 23371647@N04
comment._content: Such a travesty that this gorgeous building was knocked down to build the MLC Centre... What were they thinking?

comment.author: 8481360@N04
comment._content: I've heard so many reminiscences of the Australia Hotel, so it's finally great to see it.

comment.author: 20958381@N08
comment._content: I know ... its so awful the things that were knocked down in Sydney in the name of progress ... the Metropole Hotel, the original Wentworth and countless other buildings big & small ... but that's the way of things I suppose!

comment.author: 35672655@N00
comment._content:
@ 56m to dome, in 1891, it was Australias tallest building! even taller then the 12storey APA Building in melbourne!
it had 3storeys added in 1921 to keep up with demand and by late 1960's . it looked tired and outdated. all it needed was a refurb and removal of 3 storeys from 1921 and would have made a suberb boutique unit block. but alas, harry seidler didnt have it in his plans for MLC centre and it bit the dust in 1971. sad loss indeed.

comment.author: 29029178@N03
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Sydney's older buildings and structures. , and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Very full description of the building at the opening (Saturday 11 July 1891, by Sir Henry Parkes) from the SMH of 13/7/1891 p.5 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/13830968 . The ladies were separated from the gentlemen until the after dinner speeches!

comment.author: 35672655@N00
comment._content: thanks, yes i have that description after finding it . incredible detailed description. incredible buidling.cheers
